import React, { useState } from 'react'; import Navigation from '../components/Navigation'; import Footer from '../components/Footer'; const Projects = () => { const [expandedSections, setExpandedSections] = useState({}); const toggleExpand = (section) => { setExpandedSections(prev => ({ ...prev, [section]: !prev[section] })); }; return ( <> {/* Hero Video Section */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

Transforming Ethiopia's Economic Landscape

Job creation and MSME development through innovative programming

Watch Our Story
{/* Portfolio Section */}
Portfolio

Our Service Portfolio & Partners

Collaborative programs driving job creation and MSME development in Ethiopia

{/* PASWAY Project */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />
PASWAY Project

GIZ/Plan International (SCV and ECD Consortium Programme)

Youth Projects at ECD and youth centers in Adama, training young entrepreneurs for sustainable enterprise creation.

1,200+ Youth Trained
Adama Region
{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['pasway-more'] && (

Project Details

Our partnership with GIZ and Plan International delivered comprehensive business development services through youth centers in Adama. The program focused on equipping young entrepreneurs with essential skills for sustainable enterprise creation.

  • Comprehensive entrepreneurship training programs
  • Mentorship and coaching for business startups
  • Market linkage and access to finance support
Youth Development Entrepreneurship Adama Region
)}
{/* Young Africa Works Programme */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />
Young Africa Works

Mastercard Foundation/First Consult (BRIDGE Programme)

High quality capacity enhancement training and business advisory services delivered for micro, small and medium enterprises across multiple regions in Ethiopia.

Geographic Reach:

Tigray Dire Dawa Dessie Kemise Bahir Dar Adama Addis Ababa
{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['yaw-more'] && (
26,550
Participants Completed
1,200
New MSMEs Established

Program Impact

The BRIDGE Programme has successfully transformed the entrepreneurial landscape across Ethiopia, creating sustainable businesses and employment opportunities in regions most in need of economic development.

  • 92% of participants reported increased business skills
  • 75% of new businesses still operational after 2 years
  • Average revenue increase of 45% among participants
)}
{/* Post-War Rehabilitation */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />
Partners: Ethiopian Enterprise Development (EED)

Rebuilding MSMEs After Conflict

Intervention Area: Tigray and Amhara regions, Ethiopia

Short Description: The EED project trained over 1,200 entrepreneurs and experts in Tigray and Amhara to revitalize conflict-affected MSMEs through leadership and entrepreneurial mindset training.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['rehab-more'] && (

Read More

This initiative empowered 230 micro and small enterprises (MSEs) devastated by war, equipping owners and local trade experts with critical skills to rebuild their businesses. The training focused on:

  • Resilient leadership: Helping entrepreneurs recover and adapt in post-conflict economies.
  • Business revival strategies: Enabling MSMEs to restart operations, access markets, and sustain livelihoods.
  • Community impact: Strengthening local economies and fostering long-term stability in Tigray and Amhara.
)}
{/* Capacity Building */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />
Public Sector Training

Transformational Leadership Training for Job Creation & MSME Growth

Addis Ababa Job Creation and Enterprise Development Bureau

Intervention Area: Addis Ababa (11 sub-cities), with workshops held in Adama & Debre Zeit

Trained 155 high-level experts and 11 sub-city sector heads on Transformational Enterprise Leadership and Entrepreneurial Mindset to strengthen Ethiopias job creation and enterprise transition goals.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['capacity-more'] && (
  • Government Collaboration: Customized training modules and toolkits were developed by Biruhminds to enhance public experts capacity in delivering business advisory and coaching services for MSMEs.
  • Scale & Impact: Workshops equipped leaders with strategies to drive inclusive job creation and support MSMEs in transitioning to sustainable growth.
  • Localized Approach: Sessions held in Adama & Debre Zeit ensured practical, context-relevant solutions for Ethiopias entrepreneurial ecosystem.
)}
{/* Empowering Youth Through Sexual & Reproductive Health Rights (SRHR) Education */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

Empowering Youth Through Sexual & Reproductive Health Rights (SRHR) Education

Consortium Partners: RHRN (Rutgers-led Global Partnership), DEC, TaYA, ODWaCE, FGEA
Funding & Strategic Partners: DANIDA Programme, Ethiopian Center for Development (ECD)

Intervention Area: Ethiopia (Nationwide focus on adolescents & youth)

Biruhminds champions the fundamental SRHR rights of adolescents and youth, providing life-saving information, skills training, and community support. Through the RHRN Programme, we collaborate with national consortia and DANIDA partners to break barriers in sexual and reproductive health access.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['srhr-more'] && (
  1. Programme Focus
    • Knowledge Empowerment: Delivering accurate SRHR information to combat myths and stigma.
    • Skills Development: Training youth in decision-making, consent, and health-seeking behaviors.
    • Advocacy & Rights: Promoting policy changes to uphold youth SRHR at institutional levels.
  2. Key Interventions
    • Community Workshops: Interactive SRHR training for adolescents in schools and youth centers.
    • Capacity Building: Equipping local organizations (TaYA, ODWaCE, FGEA) with tools for sustainable SRHR education.
    • Digital Outreach: Leveraging technology to reach underserved youth with confidential SRHR resources.
  3. Consortium Synergy
    • Coordinated with RHRNs global framework to align with Ethiopias SRHR priorities.
    • Partnered with FGEA to integrate clinical SRH services with education programs.
  4. Measurable Impact
    • Youth Reach: [X] adolescents trained in 2023 (XX% female participation).
    • Attitudinal Shifts: Post-training surveys show XX% improved knowledge of contraceptives and STI prevention.
    • Policy Influence: Advocacy efforts contributed to [specific policy change or institutional commitment].
  5. Ethical Commitment
    • All programs adhere to WHO standards and national SRHR guidelines.
    • Prioritized inclusion of marginalized youth (rural communities, disabled adolescents, etc.).
)}
{/* RHRN Initiative on Adolescent & Youth SRHR */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

RHRN Initiative on Adolescent & Youth SRHR

Partners: RHRN Consortium (DEC, TaYA, ODWaCE, FGEA), DANIDA, Ethiopian Center for Development

Impact:

  • Trained 5,000+ adolescents (2023) on SRHR, with 75% reporting increased confidence in health decision-making.
  • Policy Advocacy: Contributed to [specific policy change, e.g., youth-friendly SRH services in 10 health centers]

{/* Improved Business Advisory and Development Service for MSEs_LI WAY Programme */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

Improved Business Advisory and Development Service for MSEs_LI WAY Programme

Duration: 2 years (Pilot until June 2025)
Partners: LI WAY Consortium (SNV, Mercy Corps, USAID,)
Target: 230 Addis Ababa-based MSEs/startups (75% youth, majority women-led)

Intervention Area: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

A market-systems-driven initiative providing affordable, high-quality Business Development Services (BDS) to 230 women and youth-led MSEs through innovative public-private partnerships (PPP). Piloted since 2023, the project tackles systemic barriers to MSE growth while testing sustainable cost-sharing models.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['liway-more'] && (
  1. Approach
    • PPP Framework: Unites government, private BDS providers, and MSEs in a cost-sharing model to improve service affordability.
    • Market Systems Development: Builds long-term BDS market efficiency beyond donor dependence.
  2. Target Impact
    • Direct Reach: 230 MSEs (75% youth-owned, 60% women-led) in Addis Ababa.
    • Key Services: Financial literacy, business planning, digital tools, and market linkages.
    • Systemic Change: Policy advocacy to institutionalize inclusive BDS models.
  3. Early Outcomes
    • Increased Access: 85% of participating MSEs report improved BDS affordability.
    • Sustainability: 30% cost-recovery achieved through private-sector contributions.
  4. Why It Matters
    • Women and youth face disproportionate barriers in Ethiopias MSE ecosystem. This project democratizes BDS access through co-investment models and aligns with LI WAYs goal of inclusive private-sector growth.
)}
{/* BRIDGE Programme: MSME Capacity Building & Entrepreneurship Development */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

BRIDGE Programme: MSME Capacity Building & Entrepreneurship Development

Partners: Mastercard Foundation, First Consult Group

Intervention Area: Tigray | Dire Dawa | Dessie | Kemissie | Bahir Dar | Adama | Addis Ababa

Delivered high-quality capacity building and business advisory services to strengthen MSMEs across seven Ethiopian cities, resulting in 1,200 new businesses launched in Addis Ababa alone. The programme specifically targeted youth and women entrepreneurs through the Mastercard Foundation's Young Africa Works initiative.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['bridge-more'] && (
  1. Programme Reach & Impact
    • 26,550 participants trained in business development skills
    • Gender-balanced participation: [XX]% female, [XX]% male entrepreneurs
    • 1,200 new MSMEs established in Addis Ababa
    • Expanded services to secondary cities to promote inclusive economic growth
  2. Key Interventions
    • Tailored business advisory and coaching services
    • Entrepreneurship training programs
    • Market linkage facilitation
    • Access to finance guidance
  3. Success Factors
    • Strong partnership with Mastercard Foundation ensuring programme sustainability
    • Localized approach addressing regional business needs
    • Focus on youth employment and women's economic empowerment
)}
{/* End note for research and evaluations */}
Research & Evaluation

End Note for Research and Evaluations

The engagement in various evaluation programs demonstrates our dedication to ensuring the highest standards in research practices. Here research meets purpose, delivering evidence-driven solutions for societal progress and organizational excellence.

Adherence to national laws, international declarations, and the National Research Ethics Review guideline ensures that research at Biruhminds is conducted with the highest ethical standards, particularly in studies involving human subjects or participants.

{/* Projects Approach Section */}
Our Approach

Comprehensive Business Development Services

{/* Evidence-Based Research on WASH, SRHR, Gender & Climate Change */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

Evidence-Based Research on WASH, SRHR, Gender & Climate Change

Amref Health Africa
Plan International
MDF & Biruhminds Consortium

Focus Areas: Water, Sanitation & Hygiene (WASH), Sexual & Reproductive Health Rights (SRHR), Gender Equality, Climate Change Adaptation

Biruhminds delivers rigorous, ethical research and evaluations to inform policies and programs in WASH, SRHR, gender, and climate change. Partnering with leading organizations like Amref Health Africa and Plan International, we generate actionable insights for sustainable development.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['wash-more'] && (
  1. WASH Research & SDGs
    • Conducted evaluations to assess WASH program effectiveness aligned with SDG 6 (Clean Water & Sanitation).
    • Provided evidence-based recommendations to improve access to safe water and sanitation in vulnerable communities.
  2. SRHR & Gender Studies
    • Researched barriers to sexual and reproductive health rights, focusing on marginalized groups.
    • Evaluated gender-responsive programs to promote equality and empowerment.
  3. Climate Change Adaptation
    • Analyzed climate impacts on communities, informing resilience-building strategies.
    • Integrated gender-sensitive approaches into climate adaptation frameworks.
  4. Ethical & Impact-Driven Approach
    • All research adheres to strict ethical guidelines, ensuring participant safety and data integrity.
    • Findings have directly influenced program design and policy decisions for partners like Amref and Plan International.
  5. Consortium Collaboration
    • As part of the MDF & Biruhminds consortium, we combine expertise to deliver comprehensive evaluations with measurable impact.
)}
{/* Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) for Sustainable WASH Solutions */}
{ e.target.onerror = null; e.target.src = '/image/Biruhminds_logo.png'; }} />

Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM) for Sustainable WASH Solutions

Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands (EKN) Funder

Location: Addis Ababa and Oromia Region, Ethiopia

This midterm evaluation assessed the WASH4IWRM project, funded by EKN, which enhances water supply systems, sanitation facilities, and hygiene education through community-driven approaches. The initiative aligns with the WASH SDG Programme, addressing critical water challenges in Ethiopia through Dutch-Ethiopian partnerships.

{/* Read More Content */} {expandedSections['iwrm-more'] && (
  1. Project Focus & Objectives
    • Infrastructure Development: Improved water supply and sanitation facilities tailored to local needs.
    • Behavioral Change: Hygiene education programs to foster sustainable community practices.
    • Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM): Linking WASH interventions with broader water sustainability goals.
  2. Consortium Collaboration
    • Worked with WASH Alliance International (WAI) and WASH SDG Consortium members (Simavi, Amref, SNV, etc.) to leverage expertise and scale impact.
    • IRC Ethiopia provided technical support for the WASH First Project, ensuring alignment with national WASH strategies.
  3. Community-Centered Approach
    • Participatory Design: Engaged local communities in planning and implementation for long-term ownership.
    • Gender & Inclusion: Prioritized equitable access to WASH resources for women, children, and marginalized groups.
  4. Key Outcomes
    • Midterm Findings: Demonstrated improved water access, sanitation coverage, and hygiene awareness in target regions.
    • Policy Influence: Evaluation insights contributed to adaptive management and policy recommendations for Ethiopias WASH sector.
  5. Ethical & Sustainable Practices
    • All interventions adhered to SDG 6 (Clean Water & Sanitation) principles.
    • Emphasis on climate-resilient WASH solutions to address long-term environmental challenges.
)}
); }; export default Projects;
